title-part.text: SOLAR HEAT COLLECTORS
SOLAR HEAT SYSTEMS

reference.text: for producing mechanical power from solar energy F03G6/00

note.note-paragraph:
In this subclass, the following terms or expressions are used with the meanings indicated:
"solar heat collector modules", often referred to simply as "modules", covers;
a. whole solar heat collectors b. elements of solar heat collectors, e.g. reflectors, lenses or heat storage elements.
"absorbing elements" covers elements for absorbing solar-rays and converting it into heat.
"solar heat systems" covers systems having solar heat collectors as their components and using the collected heat

title-part.text: Solar heat collectors using working fluids
the working fluids forming pools or ponds
Salt-gradient ponds
using covers or floating solar absorbing elements
having circuits for two or more working fluids

reference.text: with means for exchanging heat between two or more fluids F24S10/30

title-part.text: having two or more passages for the same working fluid layered in direction of solar-rays, e.g. having upper circulation channels connected with lower circulation channels
with means for exchanging heat between two or more working fluids
in absorbing elements surrounded by transparent enclosures, e.g. evacuated solar collectors
the working fluids being conveyed between plates

CPC-specific-text.text: having conduits formed by paired plates and internal partition means
having conduits formed by paired plates, only one of which is plane
having conduits formed by paired non-plane plates
having curved plate-like conduits, e.g. semi-spherical
having conduits formed by inflation of portions of a pair of joined sheets

title-part.text: with enlarged surfaces, e.g. with protrusions or corrugations

reference.text: collectors comprising porous materials or permeable masses directly contacting the working fluids F24S10/80

title-part.text: the working fluids trickling freely over absorbing elements
the working fluids being conveyed through tubular absorbing conduits

CPC-specific-text.text: the conduits having a non-circular cross-section
the tubular conduits being integrated in a block; the tubular conduits touching each other
the tubular conduits being of plastic material
the tubular conduits are not fixed to heat absorbing plates and are not touching each other
the conduits being parallel to each other
the conduits being otherwise bent, e.g. zig-zag

title-part.text: with enlarged surfaces, e.g. with protrusions or corrugations

reference.text: collectors comprising porous material or permeable masses directly contacting the working fluids F24S10/80

CPC-specific-text.text: the conduits being parallel to each other
the conduits being otherwise bent, e.g. zig-zag

title-part.text: comprising porous material or permeable masses directly contacting the working fluids

Group F24S10/80 is impacted by reclassification into group F24S10/95.
Groups F24S10/80 and F24S10/95 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

Group F24S10/90 is incomplete pending reclassification of documents from group F24S90/10.

All groups listed in this Warning should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

Groups F24S10/80, F24S10/90, F24S90/10, and F24S10/95 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

title-part.text: Solar heat collectors specially adapted for particular uses or environments

Group F24S20/00 is incomplete pending reclassification of documents from group F24S21/00.
Groups F24S20/00 and F24S21/00 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

CPC-specific-text.text: in the form of multiple rows and multiple columns, all solar modules being coplanar
Coplanar arrangements with frame overlapping portions

Arrangements of solar thermal modules combined with solar PV modules
having a particular shape, e.g. prismatic, pyramidal
allowing change of position for optimization of heat collection

using direct solar radiation in combination with concentrated radiation

title-part.text: Arrangement of stationary mountings or supports for solar heat collector modules

note.note-paragraph: Arrangements also intended for use with photovoltaic modules should further be classified in the relevant groups of subclass H02S.

CPC-specific-text.text: Special support components; Methods of use
Arrangements for mounting elements inside solar collectors; Spacers inside solar collectors
Filling or spacing means; Elastic means
Means for preventing movements, e.g. stops
Means for accommodating irregularities on mounting surface; Tolerance compensation means
Sealing means between support elements and mounting surface
Sealing means between support elements, e.g. overlapping arrangements; Gap closing arrangements
Means for preventing theft; Locking means

title-part.text: extending in directions away from a supporting surface
using shaped bodies, e.g. concrete elements, foamed elements or moulded box-like elements
using posts in combination with upper profiles
Profile arrangements, e.g. trusses

title-part.text: using bent plates
using assemblies of plates

for fixing modules or their peripheral frames to supporting elements

clamping by screw-threaded elements
for coupling adjacent supporting elements, e.g. for connecting profiles together
for coupling adjacent modules or their peripheral frames
